qas.question: What dopes a typical grey-box tester sets up?
What does the tester execute while performing certain actions?
What does a grey-box tester implement when they have limited information?

plausible_answers.text: the tester makes better-informed testing choices while testing the software from outside

qas.question: Knowing the overlying concepts of how software works helps testers how?
A black-box tester will usually be able to set up what type of testing environment?
What does the tester execute while preforming certain queries?
Based on lengthy information, what does grey-box testing implement?

context: By knowing the underlying concepts of how the software works, <b3_0>the tester makes better-informed testing choices while testing the software from outside<b3_0/>. Typically, a grey-box tester will be permitted to set up <a0_0>an <b4_0>isolated<b4_0/> testing environment<a0_0/> with activities such as seeding a database. The tester can observe the state of the product being tested after performing certain actions such as executing <a1_0><b5_0>SQL statements<b5_0/><a1_0/> against the database and then executing queries to ensure that the expected changes have been reflected. Grey-box testing implements <a2_0><b6_0>intelligent test scenarios<b6_0/><a2_0/>, based on limited information. This will particularly apply to data type handling, exception handling, and so on.
